snippet: Plummeting oil prices caused the British giant to write off about $5.5 billion on the value of certain assets while sharply reducing capital spending.
abstract: BP reports fourth-quarter net loss of $4.4 billion, citing write-offs of about $5.5 billion due to lower reserve estimates and falling oil prices; reports overall 2014 profit of $3.8 billion, down from $23.5 billion in 20134; results still manage to exceed analyst expectations.

byline.original: By STANLEY REED and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Stanley Reed reported from London and Clifford Krauss from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Plummeting oil prices caused the British giant to write off about $5.5 billion on the value of certain assets while sharply reducing capital spending.

headline.main: BP Posts Net Loss of $4.4 Billion in Fourth Quarter
headline.print_headline: As Oil Prices Fell, BP Swung to a $4.4 Billion Loss in Its Fourth Quarter
